|religion = Jewish |footnotes = |signature = }} Dr 'Moses Wolf Goldberg'
(June 30, 1905 – February 17, 1964) was an Estonian-Jewish chemist who,
along with Leo Henryk Sternbach, developed a process for the synthesis of
biotin (a B vitamin) in 1949.
